article.title: Lockheed Martin to Support Federated Tactical Systems
article.author: George Seffers

tags.tag: Combat System Warfare Federated Tactical Systems

article.text: Lockheed Martin Integrated Systems, Bethesda, Maryland, is being awarded a $21,910,155 contract modification for systems engineering and integration in support of Combat System Warfare Federated Tactical Systems. SWFTS is comprised of all submarine combat system subsystems, mainly Consultation, Command, Control, Communications, Computers, and Intelligence. This effort provides for the overall architecture integration of the subsystems to achieve a single total combat system for naval battlegroup interconnectivity. The Naval Sea Systems Command, Washington, D.C., is the contracting activity.
